data.sentence: The word لَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.
data.sentence: The word يَشْعُرُونَ comes from the root ش ع ر and is associated with the meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.

data.meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.
data.sentence: The word الْعَذَابُ comes from the root ع ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.

data.meanings: to be high/lofty, raised, name, attribute. samawat - heights/heavens/rain, raining clouds. ismun - mark of identification by which one is recognised. It is a derivation of wsm (pl. asma). ism - stands for a distinguishing mark of a thing, sometimes said to signify its reality.
data.sentence: The word مُسَمًّى comes from the root س م و and is associated with the meanings: to be high/lofty, raised, name, attribute. samawat - heights/heavens/rain, raining clouds. ismun - mark of identification by which one is recognised. It is a derivation of wsm (pl. asma). ism - stands for a distinguishing mark of a thing, sometimes said to signify its reality.

data.meanings: Suddenly, unexpectedly, unawares, surprisingly or with previous causeA festival, namely EasterConfounded, perplexed or unable to see straight
data.sentence: The word بَغْتَةً comes from the root ب غ ت and is associated with the meanings: Suddenly, unexpectedly, unawares, surprisingly or with previous causeA festival, namely EasterConfounded, perplexed or unable to see straight

data.meanings: assigned/appointed/specified/decreed term, period, day of resurrection, period between creation and death, period between death and resurrection, period remaining in the world, delay/postponed/deferral of time.
data.sentence: The word أَجَلٌ comes from the root ا ج ل and is associated with the meanings: assigned/appointed/specified/decreed term, period, day of resurrection, period between creation and death, period between death and resurrection, period remaining in the world, delay/postponed/deferral of time.

data.meanings: to hasten, make speed, accelerate, be hasty, act hastily, hurry over, do speedily. ajalun - precipitation, haste. ajil - that which hastens away, transitory. ista'jala - to seek or desire to hasten, urge one to make haste in doing anything. ijlun - calf.. . 'Ajiltu (prf. 1st. sing.): I have hastened.. 'Ajiltum (prf. 2nd. plu.): They make haste.. Laa Ta'jal (prt. neg. m. sing.): Thou make no haste.. Li Ta'jala (imp. 2nd. m. sing. el.). In order to make haste.. 'Ajjala (prf. 3rd. m. sing. II): He would have hastened.. 'Ajjalnaa (prf. 1st. plu. II): We hastened.. 'Ajala : Made you depart in such haste (with 'An).. Ta'jjala (prf 3rd. m. sing. V.): He hastened.. Ista'jaltum (prf. 2nd. m. plu. X.): You sought to be hastened.. Yasta'jiluuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. X.): They seek to expedite.. Tasta'jiluuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): You seek to hasten before its (fixed time), seek to expedite.. Laa Tasta'jil (prt. neg. m. sing. X.) : Thou do not seek to hasten.. Laa Tasta'jiluu (prt. neg. plu. X.): You do not seek to hasten.. 'Ajil (v. n.): Haste; Hurry up.. 'Aajilatun (act. pic. f. sing.): Quick-passing (world); Present (transitory life).. 'Ajuulan (acc. ints. n.): Ever hasty.. Isti'jaal (v. n. X.): Hastening.. 'Ijlun (n.): Calf.
data.sentence: The word وَيَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ comes from the root ع ج ل and is associated with the meanings: to hasten, make speed, accelerate, be hasty, act hastily, hurry over, do speedily. ajalun - precipitation, haste. ajil - that which hastens away, transitory. ista'jala - to seek or desire to hasten, urge one to make haste in doing anything. ijlun - calf.. . 'Ajiltu (prf. 1st. sing.): I have hastened.. 'Ajiltum (prf. 2nd. plu.): They make haste.. Laa Ta'jal (prt. neg. m. sing.): Thou make no haste.. Li Ta'jala (imp. 2nd. m. sing. el.). In order to make haste.. 'Ajjala (prf. 3rd. m. sing. II): He would have hastened.. 'Ajjalnaa (prf. 1st. plu. II): We hastened.. 'Ajala : Made you depart in such haste (with 'An).. Ta'jjala (prf 3rd. m. sing. V.): He hastened.. Ista'jaltum (prf. 2nd. m. plu. X.): You sought to be hastened.. Yasta'jiluuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. X.): They seek to expedite.. Tasta'jiluuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): You seek to hasten before its (fixed time), seek to expedite.. Laa Tasta'jil (prt. neg. m. sing. X.) : Thou do not seek to hasten.. Laa Tasta'jiluu (prt. neg. plu. X.): You do not seek to hasten.. 'Ajil (v. n.): Haste; Hurry up.. 'Aajilatun (act. pic. f. sing.): Quick-passing (world); Present (transitory life).. 'Ajuulan (acc. ints. n.): Ever hasty.. Isti'jaal (v. n. X.): Hastening.. 'Ijlun (n.): Calf.
